  <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
&lt;font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-
align:left"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;Bank Debt&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;On March 18, 2016, we executed&amp;nbsp;an amendment to our 
credit agreement with PNC, as administrative agent for our lenders.&amp;nbsp; 
The primary purpose of the amendment was to increase liquidity 
an&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;d maintain compliance through the maturity of the agreement in 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;August 2019&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp; The revolver was reduced from 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;$250&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; million to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;
$200&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt; million and the term loan remains the same. Our debt at June 30,
2016 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;$250&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; million (term-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;
$117&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;, revolver-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;$133&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition, 
a maximum annual capex of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;$30&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; million was 
included.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Bank fees and other costs incurred in connection with the initial
facility and the amendment were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;$9.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; million, which 
were deferred and are being amortized over &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display:
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; years. The credit 
facility is collateralized by substantially all of Sunrise&amp;#x2019;s assets 
and we are the guarantor.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;The amended credit 
facility increased the maximum leverage ratio (total funded 
debt/&amp;nbsp;trailing 12 months EBITDA) from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;2.75X&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; to those listed below: &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:21.54%;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:14.40pt;padding:0pt 6.5pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-
family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;3.50X&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;;font-size:
10pt"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;The fixed charge coverage ratio was&amp;nbsp;changed to the debt 
service coverage ratio and&amp;nbsp;requires a minimum of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;1.25X&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; through the maturity of the credit 
facility.&amp;nbsp;The amendment defines the debt service coverage as trailing 
12 months EBITDA/annual debt service.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of June 30, 
2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;, we had &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;additional borrowing capacity of 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;$67&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; million.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;At June 30, 2016, our maximum leverage ratio 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;2.93X&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; and our debt service coverage 
ratio was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;2.20X&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;. &amp;nbsp;Therefore, we were in 
complian&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;ce with those &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;two ratios.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display:
inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;The interest rate on the facility 
ranges from LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;2.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; to LIBOR plus 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;4%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;, depending on our maximum leverage ratio. 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;At June 30, 2016, we were paying LIBOR at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;.46%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;3.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; for a total 
interest rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;3.96%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;New accounting rules for 2016&amp;nbsp;require that 
our&amp;nbsp;debt issu&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;ance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;costs be presented as a
direct reduction from the related debt&amp;nbsp;rather than as an 
asset.&amp;nbsp; Our December 31, 2015 balance sheet was changed to reflect the 
new rule.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Debt less debt issuance cost&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display:
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; at June 30, and December 31, 
are&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt; presented below (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;font
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(7)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-
align:left"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;Net Income per Share &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;background-color: #FFFFFF;border-top:1pt
none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt 0pt 16.2pt;background-color: #FFFFFF;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;We compute net income per share using the two-class method, which
is an allocation formula that determines net income per share for common stock 
and participating securities, which for us are our outstanding RSUs. 
&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;background-color: #FFFFFF;border-top:1pt
none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;The following table sets forth the computation of net income per 
share for the six and three months ended June 30 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-

&lt;font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-
align:left"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;Equity Investment in 
Savoy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;We &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;own a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;40%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; interest in Savoy 
Energy, L.P., a private company engaged in the oil and gas business primarily in
the state of Michigan.&amp;nbsp; Savoy uses the successful efforts method of 
accounting.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We account for our interest using the equity 
method of accounting.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Below (in thousands) to the 100% is a condensed balance sheet at 
June 30, and a condensed statement of operations for the six months ended June 
30&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font

align:left"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;Equity Investment in Sunrise Energy 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;We own a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; interest in Sunrise Energy, LLC, 
which owns gas reserves and gathering equipment with plans to develop and 
operate such reserves. Sunrise Energy also plans to develop and explore for oil,
gas and coal-bed methane gas reserves on or near our underground coal reserves. 
They use the successful efforts method of accounting. We account for our 
interest using the equity method of accounting.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Below (in thousands) to the 100% is a condensed balance sheet at 
June 30, and a condensed statement of operations for the six months ended June 
30&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;

<us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt 0pt 16.2pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-
size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times 
New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 36pt 0pt 
0pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;Asset Realization &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;As disclosed last year, we significantly curtailed the production
at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;the Carlisle Mine&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; and had a reduction in work force.
Consequently, we conducted a review of those assets for recoverability and 
determined that &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; impairment charge was necessary. 
In conducting such review, we assumed: (i) that natgas prices will start to 
increase in late 2017; (ii) Carlisle production will increase in 2018-2019, and 
(iii) sometime in 2020, the Carlisle Mine will return to its normal production 
capacity of&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;3.3 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;million tons per year. The Carlisle
assets had an aggregate carrying value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;$136&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;million at June 30, 
2016.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;If, in later quarters, we reduce our estimate of the 
future net cash flows attributable to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;the Carlisle 
Mine&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;, it may result in future impairment of such assets and such 
charges could be significant. &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;color:#2A2A2A;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-weight:bold;color:#2A2A2A;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:bold;color:#2A2A2A;font-size:10pt;;font-size: 
10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 
36pt 0pt 0pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:bold;color:#2A2A2A;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:bold;color:#2A2A2A;font-size:10pt;"&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Our effectiv&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;e tax rate (ETR) for first half 2016 was 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; compared to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;29%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;first half &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;2015. 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Assuming no changes in our expected results of operations, we 
expect our ETR for the last half 2016 and for the year 2017 to be about the same
as first half 2016.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Our ETR differs from the statutory rate 
due primarily to statutory depletion in excess of tax basis, which is a 
permanent difference.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
size:10pt;"&gt;The purchase price allocation for the acquisition was as follows 
(in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div style="width:100%"&gt;&lt;table cellpadding="0"
cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-
left:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;

  <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
&lt;font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-
align:left"&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;"&gt;General Business&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;The interim financial data is unaudited; however, in our opinion,
it includes all adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring adjustments 
necessary for a fair statement of the results for the interim 
periods.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The financial statements included herein have been 
prepared pursuant to the SEC&amp;#x2019;s rules and regulations; accordingly, 
certain information and footnote disclosures normally included in GAAP financial
statements have been condensed or omitted. &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;The results of operations and cash flows for the six months ended
June 30, 2016 are not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for 
future quarters or for the year ending December 31, 2016.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;To 
maintain consistency and comparability, certain 2015 amounts have been 
reclassified to conform to the 2016 presentation.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;Our organization and business, the accounting policies we follow 
and other information, are contained in the notes to our consolidated financial 
statements filed as part of our 2015 Form 10-K. This quarterly report should be 
read in conjunction with such 10-K.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of 
Hallador Energy Company (the Company) and its wholly-owned subsidiary Sunrise
Coal, LLC (Sunrise) and Sunrise&amp;#x2019;s wholly-owned 
subsidiaries.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All significant intercompany accounts and 
transactions have been eliminated.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We are engaged in the 
production of steam coal from mines located in western 
Indiana.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We own a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;40%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; equity interest in
Savoy Energy, L.P., a private oil and gas company, which has operations in 
Michigan and a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; interest in Sunrise Energy, LLC, a
private entity engaged in oil and gas operations in the same vicinity as the 
Carlisle Mine.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;font-family:Times New
Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;"&gt;Change in Estimate for Computing 
Depreciation&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;At the beginning of Q1 2016, we changed from the straight-line 
method to the units-of-production method in com&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;puting the 
depreciation for certain &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;underground mining 
equipment.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This change in estimate reduc&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;ed our DD&amp;amp;A
expense for the six months ended June 30, 2016 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;by 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;$3.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt; million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As disclosed last 
year, we significantly curtailed the production at the Carlisle 
Mine.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This change better reflects the usage of our 
underground mining equipment especially since Carlisle h&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;ad limited 
production during first half 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

interest rate swaps.  Such amounts were $249 and $(702) for Q2 2016 and 2015, 
respectively.</link:footnote>

comprehensive income.</link:footnote>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_AccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilitiesCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of
obligations incurred through that date and due within one year (or the operating
cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have 
typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received,
taxes, interest, rent and utilities, accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes
and fringe benefits.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsReceivableNetCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of 
the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for
goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold
in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair 
value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain
of collection.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other 
events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period 
end. Excludes Net Income (Loss), and accumulated changes in equity from 
transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. 
Includes foreign currency translation items, certain pension adjustments, 
unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity 
securities, other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors 
other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt 
securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than
not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized 
cost basis, as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the 
effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AdditionalPaidInCapital">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the 
entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving 
the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in 
capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of 
debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity
instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of 
additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For 
additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock, use the element 
additional paid in capital, common stock. For additional paid-in capital 
associated with only preferred stock, use the element additional paid in 
capital, preferred stock.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Noncurrent portion of the carrying amount of a liability 
for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal 
obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived 
asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the 
normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of 
lessees.</p></div>

transactions or events.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingencies">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to
indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements
that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms 
thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, 
arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future 
performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from 
uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events 
that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvestments">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>This item represents the carrying amount on the entity's 
balance sheet of its investment in common stock of an equity method investee. 
This is not an indicator of the fair value of the investment, rather it is the 
initial cost adjusted for the entity's share of earnings and losses of the 
investee, adjusted for any distributions (dividends) and other than temporary 
impairment (OTTI) losses recognized.</p></div>

obligations.</p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the
noncurrent portion of long-term obligations drawn from a line of credit, which 
is a bank's commitment to make loans up to a specific amount. Examples of items 
that might be included in the application of this element may consist of letters
of credit, standby letters of credit, and revolving credit arrangements, under 
which borrowings can be made up to a maximum amount as of any point in time 
conditional on satisfaction of specified terms before, as of and after the date 
of drawdowns on the line. Includes short-term obligations that would normally be
classified as current liabilities but for which (a) postbalance sheet date 
issuance of a long term obligation to refinance the short term obligation on a 
long term basis, or (b) the enterprise has entered into a financing agreement 
that clearly permits the enterprise to refinance the short-term obligation on a 
long term basis and the following conditions are met (1) the agreement does not 
expire within 1 year and is not cancelable by the lender except for violation of
an objectively determinable provision, (2) no violation exists at the BS date, 
and (3) the lender has entered into the financing agreement is expected to be 
financially capable of honoring the agreement.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.22)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 470<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section 45<br> -Paragraph 13<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=28361426&amp;loc=d3e1314-
112600<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 470<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section 45<br> -Paragraph 14<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=28361426&amp;loc=d3e1336-
112600<br><br>Reference 4: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Glossary Line-
of-Credit Arrangement<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6517033<br></p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's 
undistributed earnings or deficit.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.31(a)(3))<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher SEC<br> -Name Regulation S-X (SX)<br> -Number 210<br> -Section 04<br>
-Article 3<br></p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0">
<tr>
<td><strong> Name:</strong></td>
<td style="white-space:nowrap;">us-gaap_RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit</td>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 310<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 2<br> -Subparagraph (SAB TOPIC 4.E)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=27010918&amp;loc=d3e74512-
122707<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
02.29-31)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher SEC<br> -Name Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB)<br> -Number Topic 4<br>
-Section E<br></p></div>

style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_PreferredStockSharesIssued">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total number of nonredeemable preferred shares (or 
preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) issued to 
shareholders (includes related preferred shares that were issued, repurchased, 
and remain in the treasury). May be all or portion of the number of preferred 
shares authorized. Excludes preferred shares that are classified as 
debt.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.28)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher SEC<br> -Name Regulation S-X (SX)<br> -Number 210<br> -Section 02<br>
-Paragraph 29<br> -Article 5<br></p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0">

<tr><td colspan="6"><table class="outerFootnotes" width="100%">
<tr class="outerFootnote">
<td style="vertical-align: top; width: 12pt;" valign="top">[1]</td>
<td style="vertical-align: top;" valign="top">Interest expense for first half 
2016 and 2015 includes $1,748 and $607, respectively, for the net change in the 
estimated fair value of our interest rate swaps.  Such amounts were $249 and 
$(702) for Q2 2016 and 2015, respectively.</td>
</tr>
<tr class="outerFootnote">
<td style="vertical-align: top; width: 12pt;" valign="top">[2]</td>
<td style="vertical-align: top;" valign="top">There is no material difference 
between net income and comprehensive income.</td>
</tr>

Definition</a><div><p>The aggregate expense recognized in the current period

assets to periods that benefit from use of the assets.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The amount of net income or loss for the period per each 
share in instances when basic and diluted earnings per share are the same amount
and reported as a single line item on the face of the financial statements.  
Basic earnings per share is the amount of net income or loss for the period per 
each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.  
Diluted earnings per share includes the amount of net income or loss for the 
period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during
the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding 
assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential 
common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

Definition</a><div><p>Amount of revenue recognized from goods sold, services 
rendered, insurance premiums, or other activities that constitute an earning 
process. Includes, but is not limited to, investment and interest income before 
deduction of interest expense when recognized as a component of revenue, and 
sales and trading gain (loss).</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_SellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpense">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The aggregate total costs related to selling a firm's 
product and services, as well as all other general and administrative expenses. 
Direct selling expenses (for example, credit, warranty, and advertising) are 
expenses that can be directly linked to the sale of specific products. Indirect 
selling expenses are expenses that cannot be directly linked to the sale of 
specific products, for example telephone expenses, Internet, and postal charges.
General and administrative expenses include salaries of non-sales personnel, 
rent, utilities, communication, etc.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<td>duration</td>
</tr>
</table></div>
</div></td></tr>
</table>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of increase (decrease) in cash and cash 
equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents are the amount of currency on hand as 
well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other 
kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also
includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible
to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present 
insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.
Includes effect from exchange rate changes.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivitiesContinuingOperations">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of financing activities, 
excluding discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include 
obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a 
return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or 
settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained 
from creditors on long-term credit.</p></div>

onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Number of shares of stock issued as of the balance sheet 
date, including shares that had been issued and were previously outstanding but 
which are now held in the treasury.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 505<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
50<br> -Paragraph 2<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6928386&amp;loc=d3e21463-
112644<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name

S99<br> -Paragraph 2<br> -Subparagraph (SAB TOPIC 4.E)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=27010918&amp;loc=d3e74512-
122707<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
02.29-31)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br>

<span style="display: none;">v3.5.0.2</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idp6724822720">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 
200px;"><strong>General Business<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2016</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_AccountingPoliciesAbstract', window );"><strong>General Business 
[Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock', window );">General 
Business</a></td>
<td class="text"><div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;">
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">(1)</font></font><font style="text-
indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-align:left"><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;">General Business</font></font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">The interim financial data is unaudited; however, in our opinion, it
includes all adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring adjustments 
necessary for a fair statement of the results for the interim 
periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;The financial statements included herein have been prepared 
pursuant to the SEC&#x2019;s rules and regulations; accordingly, certain 
information and footnote disclosures normally included in GAAP financial 
statements have been condensed or omitted. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">The results of operations and cash flows for the six months ended 
June 30, 2016 are not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for 
future quarters or for the year ending December 31, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;To maintain
consistency and comparability, certain 2015 amounts have been reclassified to 
conform to the 2016 presentation.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">Our organization and business, the accounting policies we follow and
other information, are contained in the notes to our consolidated financial 
statements filed as part of our 2015 Form 10-K. This quarterly report should be 
read in conjunction with such 10-K.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of 
Hallador Energy Company (the Company) and its wholly-owned subsidiary Sunrise 
Coal, LLC (Sunrise) and Sunrise&#x2019;s wholly-owned 
subsidiaries.&nbsp;&nbsp;All significant intercompany accounts and transactions 
have been eliminated.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are engaged in the production of steam coal 
from mines located in western Indiana.&nbsp;&nbsp;We own a </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">40%</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> equity interest in 
Savoy Energy, L.P., a private oil and gas company, which has operations in 
Michigan and a </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">50%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> interest in Sunrise Energy, LLC, a private entity engaged in oil 
and gas operations in the same vicinity as the Carlisle Mine.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;font-family:Times New
Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;">Change in Estimate for Computing 
Depreciation</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">At the beginning of Q1 2016, we changed from the straight-line 
method to the units-of-production method in com</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">puting the depreciation for certain 
</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">underground mining equipment.&nbsp;&nbsp;This change in estimate 
reduc</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">ed 
our DD&amp;A expense for the six months ended June 30, 2016 </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">by </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.5</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> 
million.&nbsp;&nbsp;As disclosed last year, we significantly curtailed the 
production at the Carlisle Mine.&nbsp;&nbsp;This change better reflects the 
usage of our underground mining equipment especially since Carlisle 
h</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">ad
limited production during first half 2016</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p><font size="1"> </font></p>
</div> </div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<span style="display: none;">v3.5.0.2</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idp6723630976">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>Bank 
Debt<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2016</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_DebtDisclosureAbstract', window );"><strong>Bank Debt 
[Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock', window );">Bank Debt</a></td>
<td class="text"><div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;">
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">(2)</font></font><font style="text-
indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-align:left"><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">Bank 
Debt</font></font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">On March 18, 2016, we executed&nbsp;an amendment to our credit 
agreement with PNC, as administrative agent for our lenders.&nbsp; The primary 
purpose of the amendment was to increase liquidity an</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d maintain compliance 
through the maturity of the agreement in </font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">August 2019</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.&nbsp; The revolver 
was reduced from </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">$250</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> million to </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$200</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> million and the term loan remains the same. Our 
debt at June 30, 2016 was </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$250</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> million (term-</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$117</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, revolver-</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$133</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">).&nbsp;&nbsp;In 
addition, a maximum annual capex of </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$30</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> million was included.</font><font style="display:
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">Bank fees and other costs incurred in connection with the initial 
facility and the amendment were </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$9.1</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> million, which were deferred and are being 
amortized over </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">five</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> years. The credit facility is collateralized by substantially all 
of Sunrise&#x2019;s assets and we are the guarantor.&nbsp; </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font><br /><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The amended credit facility increased the maximum 
leverage ratio (total funded debt/&nbsp;trailing 12 months EBITDA) from 
</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">2.75X</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> to those listed below: </font>
</p>

<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
</p>
<p><font size="1"> </font></p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;;font-size:
10pt"><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The fixed 
charge coverage ratio was&nbsp;changed to the debt service coverage ratio 
and&nbsp;requires a minimum of </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.25X</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> through the maturity of the credit
facility.&nbsp;The amendment defines the debt service coverage as trailing 12 
months EBITDA/annual debt service.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of June 30, 2016</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, we had </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">additional borrowing 
capacity of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">$67</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> million.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">At June 30, 2016, our maximum leverage ratio </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">was </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2.93X</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and our debt service 
coverage ratio was </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">2.20X</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">. &nbsp;Therefore, we were in complian</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">ce with those </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">two ratios.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font><br /><font
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The interest rate on 
the facility ranges from LIBOR plus </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2.25%</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> to LIBOR plus </font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">4%</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, depending on our maximum leverage 
ratio. </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">At
June 30, 2016, we were paying LIBOR at </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.46%</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> plus </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">3.50%</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> for a total interest rate of </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">3.96%</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">New accounting rules for 2016&nbsp;require that our&nbsp;debt 
issu</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">ance</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&nbsp;costs be presented as a direct reduction from the related 
debt&nbsp;rather than as an asset.&nbsp; Our December 31, 2015 balance sheet was
changed to reflect the new rule.</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">Debt less debt issuance cost</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> at June 30, and December 31, 
are</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">
presented below (in thousands):</font><br /><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"></font>
</p>
<div style="width:100%"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"
style="border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;">

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for information about short-term and
long-term debt arrangements, which includes amounts of borrowings under each 
line of credit, note payable, commercial paper issue, bonds indenture, debenture
issue, own-share lending arrangements and any other contractual agreement to 
repay funds, and about the underlying arrangements, rationale for a 
classification as long-term, including repayment terms, interest rates, 
collateral provided, restrictions on use of assets and activities, whether or 
not in compliance with debt covenants, and other matters important to users of 
the financial statements, such as the effects of refinancing and noncompliance 
with debt covenants.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 505<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
50<br> -Paragraph 3<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6928386&amp;loc=d3e21475-
112644<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
02.19,20,22)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br></p></div>

gaap_EquityMethodInvestmentsDisclosureTextBlock', window );">Investment</a></td>
<td class="text"><div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;">
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">(3)</font></font><font style="text-
indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-align:left"><font 
style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">Equity Investment in Savoy</font></font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">We </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">own a </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">40%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> interest in Savoy Energy, L.P., a private company engaged in the 
oil and gas business primarily in the state of Michigan.&nbsp; Savoy uses the 
successful efforts method of accounting.&nbsp;&nbsp;We account for our interest 
using the equity method of accounting.&nbsp; </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">Below (in thousands) to the 100% is a condensed balance sheet at 
June 30, and a condensed statement of operations for the six months ended June 
30</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for equity method investments and 
joint ventures. Equity method investments are investments that give the investor
the ability to exercise significant influence over the operating and financial 
policies of an investee. Joint ventures are entities owned and operated by a 
small group of businesses as a separate and specific business or project for the
mutual benefit of the members of the group.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<td class="text"><div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;">
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-
right:24pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">(4)</font></font><font style="text-
indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-right:4pt;text-align:left"><font 
style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">Equity Investment in Sunrise Energy </font></font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">We own a </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">50%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;"> interest in Sunrise Energy, LLC, which owns gas reserves and 
gathering equipment with plans to develop and operate such reserves. Sunrise 
Energy also plans to develop and explore for oil, gas and coal-bed methane gas 
reserves on or near our underground coal reserves. They use the successful 
efforts method of accounting. We account for our interest using the equity 
method of accounting.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
</p>

June 30, and a condensed statement of operations for the six months ended June 
30</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.&nbsp;

<p style="margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New
Roman;font-size: 10pt">
size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#xFEFF;</font>
<font style="font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-
</p>
<p><font size="1"> </font></p>
</div> </div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_EquityMethodInvestmentsDisclosureTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for equity method investments and 
joint ventures. Equity method investments are investments that give the investor
the ability to exercise significant influence over the operating and financial 
policies of an investee. Joint ventures are entities owned and operated by a 
small group of businesses as a separate and specific business or project for the
mutual benefit of the members of the group.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 323<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
50<br> -Paragraph 3<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6382943&amp;loc=d3e33918-
111571<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 323<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section 35<br> -Paragraph 35<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=49116238&amp;loc=d3e32847-
111569<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
02.12)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 4: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 323<br>

<font style="text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt; padding-

<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-

</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt">
<font style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-
size:10pt;">We self-insure our underground mining equipment.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such 
equipment is allocated among </font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">10</font><font style="display: inline;font-
family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> mining units spread out over </font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">20</font><font 
style="display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> miles.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
historical cost of such equipment is about </font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$25</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">5</font><font style="display: 
inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> million.</font>

<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2016</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">

<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
